item.title: Aleuvare
item.dc:creator: @kirikugi kirikugi
item.description:
@kirikugi wrote:

[quote=“amy_webb, post:8, topic:518590”][quote author=kirikugi link=topic=636855.msg4293864#msg4293864 date=1367862595]

Very nice concept, and good colouring. Suggestions i can make are you could use less poly in areas (mainly on the blade), and try make the hilt and blade one model. Also, i can see how you changed the main render photo and the wireframe photo, where the spikes are. The render looks better, looks smoother and it goes with the little ( piece you have on the blade.

I use the poly strictly for the coloring basis and as for the hilt and the blade ;3 they are only one prim believe it or not. alot of knifing was required to obtain that hilt from the blade. as well as extruding. And i used symmetrical throughout the whole model.
[/quote]
I see, I usually try make the best out of colors after i’ve finished my model based on low poly for servers. They may have been from one prim but that stops them from being one model once you cut them. :P[/quote] i color in the midst of modeling or i would lose my sense of direction on the model and usually find myself hitting a wall until i add some colors to contrast. i usually use strictly black and white as a coloring contrast till i find the image im hoping to obtain.

Read full topic

item.title: Aleuvare
item.dc:creator: @amy_webb1 amy_webb
item.description:
@amy_webb1 wrote:

[quote=“kirikugi, post:7, topic:518590”][quote author=amy_webb link=topic=636855.msg4293695#msg4293695 date=1367818597]
Very nice concept, and good colouring. Suggestions i can make are you could use less poly in areas (mainly on the blade), and try make the hilt and blade one model. Also, i can see how you changed the main render photo and the wireframe photo, where the spikes are. The render looks better, looks smoother and it goes with the little ( piece you have on the blade.
[/quote]

I use the poly strictly for the coloring basis and as for the hilt and the blade ;3 they are only one prim believe it or not. alot of knifing was required to obtain that hilt from the blade. as well as extruding. And i used symmetrical throughout the whole model.[/quote]
I see, I usually try make the best out of colours after i’ve finished my model based on low poly for servers. They may have been from one prim but that stops them from being one model once you cut them.

Read full topic

item.title: Aleuvare
item.dc:creator: @kirikugi kirikugi
item.description:
@kirikugi wrote:

amy_webb:

Very nice concept, and good colouring. Suggestions i can make are you could use less poly in areas (mainly on the blade), and try make the hilt and blade one model. Also, i can see how you changed the main render photo and the wireframe photo, where the spikes are. The render looks better, looks smoother and it goes with the little ( piece you have on the blade.

I use the poly strictly for the coloring basis and as for the hilt and the blade ;3 they are only one prim believe it or not. alot of knifing was required to obtain that hilt from the blade. as well as extruding. And i used symmetrical throughout the whole model.

[quote=“drubrkletern, post:5, topic:518590”]looks sexy

Name it Leviathan[/quote]

Im wanting something with a more noble name to it because of the colors i used

Read full topic
